alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 3:36AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Higher temperatures and rain falling on snow is accelerating the snowmelt, leading to rises on the Little Snake River near Savery. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The Little Snake River in southern Carbon County, near Savery. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to rapidly melting snowpack and additional rainfall from thunderstorms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 AM MDT, Gauge reports indicated a steady rise due to rapidly melting snowpack and additional rainfall on the snowpack. The gauge near Savery on the Little Snake River, has already exceeded a record crest of 9.5 feet and is approaching minor flood stage. Flooding may be occurring and is expected to continue through Thursday. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Snake River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Carbon County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
